channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report X-2024020133
item.description:
Report X-2024020133

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-05
  • City: EDISON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A BUBBLE MAILER CAME DOWN THE SORT OPEN. PACKAGE WAS GIVEN TO A RESPONDER WHO FOUND ONE X 12 OUNCE CONTAINER OF EXTREMELY FLAMMABLE ZIPPO LIGHTER FLUID. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BUBBLE MAILER. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT I WAS CALLED TO THE QA AREA AND HANDED THE LABEL. THERE WERE NO ZEP CONTENTS IN SIGHT. THIS PACKAGE WILL BE SCRAPPED UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF THE PACKAGE COULD CAUSE FROM THE PACKAGE BEING DROPPED OF MISHANDLED. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: I WILL BE AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report E-2024020069
item.description:
Report E-2024020069

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-30
  • City: FAIRFIELD
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On the morning of January 30, 2024, a Veolia employee was at the customer site loading a drum of sulfuric acid into their trailer when the incident occurred. The Veolia employee was maneuvering the drum to the edge of the dock, however there was no dock leveler or dock plate. The employee proceeded to get the drum cart and pick up and move the drum the rest of the way when one of the forks from the drum cart pierced the drum. The customer came to assist and pumped the damaged drum into a new drum. The damaged drum was then put into an overpack. The Veolia supervisor and EHS manager responded to assist by contacting the remediation/ spill response team to respond with a neutralizer so the truck can be cleaned up and the job can resume.

item.title: Report X-2024010766
item.description:
Report X-2024010766

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at hazmat during sunrise sort in plastic bin. DescribePack: Inspection showed package of "MEDIVATORS RAPICIDE PA" to be torn open, with 2 of 4 contents seperated and leaking. Damage most likely caused from being dropped or mishandled. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Remaining contents will be returned to shipper in a salvage drum, unless otherwise stated.

item.title: Report X-2024010821
item.description:
Report X-2024010821

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-06T18:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: IT APPEARS THE SHIPMENT WAS REMOVED FROM THE SYSTEM FLOW, DUE TO THE EXTERNAL CARTON BEING TORN AND WET DURING THE TWILIGHT SORT. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS 4 X 1 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES OF ZEP CONCENTRATED DRIVEWAY & CONCRETE PRESSURE WASH WITH TWO BOTTLES HAVING LOOSE CAPS AND CAUSING LEAKAGING ALLOWING 20% SPILLAGE. WHICH ALSO CAUSED DAMAGE TO THE OUTER PACKAGING AS WELL. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2024010729
item.description:
Report X-2024010729

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-06T18:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: TRENTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipping box crushed and torn while in transit causing Medivators Rapicide Part A 5L jug to have loose cap. Package was immediately placed in RED Tote upon discovery and brought to HAZMAT Cage for further processing. DescribePack: Shipping box crushed and torn while in transit causing Medivators Rapicide Part A 5L jug to have loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately placed in RED Tote upon discovery and brought to HAZMAT Cage for further processing.

item.title: Report X-2024010726
item.description:
Report X-2024010726

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-06T18:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-02
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERAL LEAKAGE. UPON INSPECTION 2 BOTTLES OF RAPICIDE PART B WAS FOUND TO BE MISSING AND ONE BOTTLE OF PART A TO BE SLIGHTLY LEAKING. THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURNED TO SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF RAPICIDE CAUSED FROM PACKAGE BEING DROPPED OF MISHANDLED. DurationRel: 24 and MitigateEffect: CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2024010823
item.description:
Report X-2024010823

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-06T18:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERANL LEAKAGE. UPON INSPECTION ONE BOTTLE OF DIVERSEY LIQUID PRESOAK WAS FOUND TO BE MISSING AND ONE BOTTLE CAP WAS LOOSE. THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURN SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF DIVERSEY PRESOAK CAUSED FROM THE PACKAGE BEING MISHANDLED OR DROPPED. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: THE CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURNED TO SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF RAPICIDE CAUSED FROM PACKAGE BEING DROPPED OF MISHANDLED. item.title: Report X-2024010721
item.description:
Report X-2024010721

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-06T18:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-02
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE HAZMAT WAS GOING DOWN THE NC BELT AND WHEN PKG HANDLER WENT TO TAKE IT OFF THE BELT IT FELL OFF. A MANAGER WAS NOTIFIED AND A HAZMAT QUALIFIED MEMBER PLACED IT IN A HAZMAT BAG AND HAZMAT TOTE. THEN TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO BE PROPERLY PROCESSED. DescribePack: 1 BOTTLE HAD A LOOSE CAP AND ANOTHER BOTTLE HAD A CRACK BEHIND THE HANDLE AT THE SEAM, ABOUT 2 TO 3 INCHES IN LENGTH. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: OIL DRY WAS PLACES ON THE LIQUID ON THE GROUND THEN SWEPT UP AND PUT IN A HAZMAT BAG.

Report X-2024020019

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO DOOR 50 IN THE SORT AISLE FOR A SPILL. RESPONDER USED THE DECISION TREE AND CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL AND COLLECTED MATERIAL. THEN TAKEN TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.
